greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of all primes p such that 2n - p is also prime.
comment: Product of n-th row in triangle A171637;
All terms greater than 3 are odd, composite and squarefree numbers, cf. A024556.
n is prime iff n is a factor of a(n).
Product of the distinct primes in the Goldbach partitions of 2n. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 29 2020
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..2000
formula: a(n) = n^c(n) * Product_{i=1..n-1} (i*(2*n-i))^(c(i)*c(2*n-i)), where c is the prime characteristic (A010051). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 29 2020
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 06 2014
